article.headline: UC Santa Barbara 77, Loyola Marymount 67
article.story: SANTA BARBARA, Calif. -- James Nunnally scored a career-high 29 points and UC Santa Barbara shot 61.7 percent in a 77-67 victory over Loyola Marymount on Wednesday night. Nunnally hit four 3-pointers and was 11 of 14 from the field while the Gauchos (3-3) made 29-of-47 shots. Orlando Johnson added 11 points. Larry Davis had six 3s and tied his career-high with 27 points to lead the Lions (3-5). Vernon Teel finished with 13 points and Anthony Ireland had 10. Loyola Marymount trailed by seven early in the second half before pulling to within 53-52 on Teel's layup with 9:56 remaining. Nunnally then took over, leading an 18-0 run. He scored 13 of the next 16 points and assisted on Jordan Weiner's 3-pointer. UC Santa Barbara led by at least eight the rest of the way.

statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover
